# Question

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

Here is the Julia code for your problem:

```julia
function wrap_string(s::String, text_width::Int = 10)
    words = split(s, " ")
    result = ""
    line = ""
    for word in words
        if length(line * " " * word) > text_width
            result *= "\n" * line
            line = word
        else
            line *= " " * word
        end
    end
    result *= "\n" * line
    return result
end
```

You can use this function like:

```julia
s = "Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Sed do eiusmod tempor incididunt ut labore et dolore magna aliqua."
println(wrap_string(s))
```

This will print the string `s` with each word on a new line if it exceeds the maximum width of 10 characters. If you want to change the default width, you can pass it as an argument like:

```julia
println(wrap_string(s, 20))
```
